title: Getting Started with t4stats
text: t4stats computes four statistics numeric vector: Function (C++): Sample variance (unbiased, divides n − 1) Function B (C++): Arithmetic mean Mean (R): mean(x) Variance (R): stats::var(x) single helper, run_all(x), prints four results returns list.

title: Getting Started with t4stats
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)    out <- run_all(x)   # prints 4 lines and returns a list invisibly    str(out)

title: Getting Started with t4stats
text: ship CSV package, put inst/extdata/. access like : Tip: Don’t keep data top level package—R CMD check note . Prefer storing inst/extdata/.
code: csv_path <- system.file("extdata", "Data501_Dataset_Assignment1.csv", package = "t4stats")    dat <- read.csv(csv_path, header = TRUE)    x <- as.numeric(dat[[1]]) + 563      # example offset from the assignment    run_all(x)

title: Getting Started with t4stats
text: my_function_A() uses unbiased sample variance formula: ∑(xᵢ − x̄)² / (n − 1) my_function_B() computes arithmetic mean: (1 / n) ∑ xᵢ
code: mean_R(1:5)       # R mean    variance_R(1:5)   # R sample variance     # C++ implementations are called inside run_all(), but are also available:    t4stats:::my_function_A(1:5)  # variance in C++    t4stats:::my_function_B(1:5)  # mean in C++

title: Getting Started with t4stats
text: Adding constant values changes mean variance. “Function Results: …” “Function B Results: …” “Mean: …” “Variance: …”

title: Getting Started with t4stats
code: # from the package root    devtools::document()    devtools::build()    devtools::install()    library(t4stats)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Singh T (2025). t4stats: Demonstrates Mean Variance calculated using C++ R funtions. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {t4stats: Demonstrates Mean and Variance calculated using C++ and R funtions},   author = {Tanveer Singh},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: run_all — run_all
text: Print four results (variance function C++, B mean function C++, mean R, variance R)
